intro: Isoetes caroli, commonly known as the Carolinian water clover, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the order Isoetales. It is characterized by its distinctive, ribbon-like leaves that are typically submerged or floating in freshwater environments. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are clustered in dense, spore-producing cones. Isoetes caroli is often found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats such as ponds and lakes. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
